results.title: I witness: the art of George Gittoes (D)
results.creator_credit: Don Featherstone, Australian Broadcasting Corporation and Featherstone Productions
results.brief_description: Australian artist, photographer and writer George Gittoes reflects the darker side of human nature in his paintings, the evil side which many artists are unwilling to acknowledge or address. In his own words “the story is more important than the drawing”. A deeply religious and spiritual person Gittoes has traversed the world and all its horrific wars including Rwanda, Bosnia, Vietnam, Northern Ireland and the Middle East. He admits he is not interested in national boundaries only that he is totally passionate in his hatred of human violence and war. This revealing and often confronting documentary follows his journey to China during the 1998 floods where we see him as a street artist capturing the lives of ordinary Chinese citizens as they go about their daily lives; travelling down the great Yangtze River to the construction site of the Three Gorges Dam; and at work in his Beijing studio. Throughout the film which is interspersed with images of a variety of his works, Gittoes talks about his life, his family, his philosophy on humanity and the stories behind each of the paintings portrayed in this program. This is one artist who is not afraid to push the boundaries. NB: CONTAINS SEVERAL DISTURBING IMAGES OF WAR AND ITS VICTIMS.

results.title: I was a ninety pound weakling. - Rev. ed.
results.creator_credit: Georges Dufaux, Roman Kroitor, Wolf Koenig and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: A round-up of what goes on in the toe-touching parlors of a large city. Here you see modern man brought to bay by his own poundage, resolved to erase by exercise what rich food, idleness and age have put on. In yoga headstand schools and flesh-shrinking lofts, high resolves to beat the bulge reach strange and sometimes amusing ends. (A revised version of the original film of the same title.)

results.title: I want to be an engineer
results.creator_credit: Beverly Shaffer, Margaret Pettigrew and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: This film provides a lively introduction to the professional and personal lives of three female engineers - just a few of the growing number of women who are opting for “non-traditional” jobs. Their enthusiasm for and commitment to their work makes them convincing role models for high-school girls who might be considering engineering as a career possibility. As well, the film is effective in fostering positive attitudes towards women working in the traditionally male professions of science and technology.

results.title: I Think they think: overcoming social phobia
results.creator_credit: Christine Mason, Christopher Thomas and Monkey See Productions
results.brief_description: Three sufferers of social phobia, a devastating anxiety disorder, share their experiences with the condition and the techniques they used to successfully overcome it. The techniques are based on cognitive behaviour therapy, which has proven to be successful in most treatment of social phobia. The program is intended for sufferers, family and friends, and health care workers. It covers defining social phobia, monitoring anxiety, cognitive behaviour therapy, managing anxiety through meditation, and medication.

results.title: I never loved you
results.creator_credit: Cassandra Tytler, Corinne Preston, Rebecca McPherson and Monkey Suit Productions
results.brief_description: Broken hearts, longing and regret…..”I Never loved you” does a tango and a twirl around the question of love. It exalts in the high passion and tragedy of love and romance, all the while too aware that love can be finite and fleeting. Tough guys singing tender songs to gals with innocent hearts but eyes that have seen too much; doe-eyed lovers are left with bloodshot eyes, nursing regret and a broken heart; the carousel of love moves on, passion can make you giddy and then throw you off balance. Where did it all go wrong? Cast includes: Alex Ben Mayor, Louise Woodward, Connal Parsley, Charlie Sheldon.

results.title: I Know they can get me pregnant (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Would-be mothers, patients at the In-Vitro Fertilisation Clinic at the Royal North Shore Hospital, describe their feelings. This program provides material for discussion on such topics as the role of the social worker, the ethics of test-tube babies and the care of patients.

results.title: I Know a secret (K)
results.creator_credit: Bruce Pittman, Janice Platt, Michael Macmillan, Seaton McLean and Atlantis Films
results.brief_description: A film adaptation of a short story by Lucy Maud Montgomery set during the late 1930s. The story is about a young girl called Jane Lawrence, and some children she becomes acquainted with after she moves to the country with her mother to live.
